title: Revealed: the two Extinction Rebellion protestors who dared to cross a crowd of angry commuters
text:
Extinction Rebellion organisers admitted a disastrous rush-hour protest had been a “huge own goal” after activists were set upon by a crowd of angry commuters.

Two protestors who clambered onto a carriage at Canning Town tube station were swiftly confronted by passengers who dragged them down onto the platform.

Both were then kicked and punched by angry workers before Underground staff stepped in to defend them, according to widely-shared footage.

Scotland Yard yesterday condemned the actions of commuters who took “matters into their own hands” and said they would face a full police investigation. But politicians and industry groups led a widespread backlash against Extinction Rebellion, saying...
description: Extinction Rebellion organisers admitted a disastrous rush-hour protest had been a “huge own goal” after activists were set upon by a crowd of angry commuters.
